metadata.Title: CVE-2023-47235 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in FRRouting FRR through 9.0.1. A crash can occur when a malformed BGP UPDATE message with an EOR is processed, because the presence of EOR does not lead to a treat-as-withdraw outcome.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-47235` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.1-1ubuntu1.8
frr-pythontools - 8.1-1ubuntu1.8
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.1-1ubuntu1.8
frr-snmp - 8.1-1ubuntu1.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> the quagga project was renamed to frr mdeslaur> The code in quagga is different, there is no indication quagga is vulnerable to this issue, marking as not-affected for now

criterions.comment: frr package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1-1ubuntu1.8').
